entry.title: Newsletter #59
entry.content:
Hello, It’s #TechThursday at #namshi again!

News from the IT Team: Well, not so much today, it was a short week thanks to the cool EID break :)

But what has the team been looking at over the past week? Below you’ll find the usual list of interesting articles we discovered in the past 7 days.

  • JavaScript MV* Framework compared

  • The Definitive Guide to the JavaScript Generators

  • Cyclomatic and NPath complexity explained

  • Best Practices for Designing a Pragmatic RESTful API

  • ECMAScript 6 new String Methods

  • Interesting lib of utility function. Use with caution, it touched the prototype (as the name suggestes)

  • WhichBrowser – User agent sniffing gone too far

  • Things that programmers know, but most people don’t?

  • Worse Is Better, for Better or for Worse

  • 9 anti-patterns for node.js teams

  • Dubai police add facial recognition to Google Glass

  • How does a computer chip work?

  • Top 10 mistakes AngularJS developers make

  • A multi-container Symfony2 setup with Docker

  • Move Fast and Break Nothing

  • New in Symfony 2.6: Security component improvements

  • Nightmare.js, a high level wrapper for phantomJS

  • A Symfony bundle for providing Rate Limiting for your APIs

  • awesome shell

  • Design How Your Objects Talk Through Mocking

  • The Better Parts, the new talk by Douglas Crockford. Mind blowing, not just for Js, about programming in general

  • PHP 5.6 new features

  • The cookie is dead. Here’s how Facebook, Google, and Apple are tracking you now

  • Refactoring Ruby with Monads

  • A tmux Crash Course

  • Move Fast and Break Nothing

  • Push our limits – reliability testing at Twitter

  • New in Symfony 2.6: Bootstrap form theme

  • New in Symfony 2.6: Simpler Security Voters

  • AltoRouter, simple PHP router inspired by Sinatra

  • A Better Dev/Test Experience: Docker and AWS

  • Docker Cleanup Commands

  • A PHP development environment with Docker

  • PuppetConf 2014 slides

  • Zonify is a set of command line tools for managing Route53 DNS for an AWS infrastructure

  • Infrastructure automation by example

  • Using Machine Learning and NodeJS to detect the gender of Instagram Users

  • Building OS X Apps with JavaScript

  • Writing a Simple Operating System from Scratch

entry.title: Newsletter #50
entry.content:
Hey folks! Hope you had a great week!

Announcement:

We are looking for a senior software engineer passionate about NodeJS and a frontend designer who is passionate and kick-ass in CSS and HTML and wants to expand his skillset with some JavaScript — we <3 javascript :)

We will detail in a separate post but, for the time being, feel free to reach out to submit your linkedin / github profile to work-in-tech@namshi.com

Here are your links for this week!

  • Mind-blowing facts about Google
  • Is TLS Fast Yet?
  • Amazon RDS Now Supports T2 Instances
  • The One Big Thing That Will Reduce Software Bugs, But No One Does It
  • CoreOS and Docker through Deis: Your Paas. Your Rules.
  • The Twelve-Factor App
  • Redis 3.0.0 beta 8 is out
  • Critiquing Facebook’s new #PHP spec
  • ideavim – plugin that let’s you use vim keybindings inside a intellj based ides (phpstorm/webstorm ide
  • A very old post, but still super good, about object oriented programming in JavaScript
  • Why does windows think that my wireless keyboard is a toaster
  • Game of Hacks
  • Why I think having passion as a developer matters
  • BadUSB what if you could never trust a USB device again
  • 3 security mistakes small companies make and how to avoid them
  • Track and Audit shipments for free
  • DConf 2014: Declarative programming in D by Mihails Strasuns aka Dicebot
  • Welcome to RocksDB!
  • Alerting Dashboard for Graphite
  • Why You Can’t Learn To Code Without Open Source
  • JavaScript Promises Are Cool
  • The Top Programming Languages in IEEE Spectrum’s 2014 Ranking
  • Building a Better PHP – Part 5: Static Analysis & other CLI tools
  • dotScale 2014 – Fabien Potencier – My Take on PHP
